headline: REPORT: Dem senator slams Biden’s Title 42 decision as inconsistent with mask extension
author: DML News App
sentences:
Kelly calls it the “wrong decision” as Sinema says it shows a “lack of understanding about the crisis at our border.” pic.twitter.com/Lw0UiYQ7I8
— Adam Shaw (@AdamShawNY) April 1, 2022
Don’t forget: Last week Sinema and 4 other Democratic/ 6 Republican senators introduced a bill that would prevent the Biden admin from ending Title 42 without a detailed plan in place to stop an expected surge of migrants at the border https://t.co/Uygz7ORVVC https://t.co/waxqmaD9ZI
— Alayna Treene (@alaynatreene) April 14, 2022
Listen to the latest daily DML podcasts below!

“I’ll keep pushing for transparency and accountability from the administration to help secure the border, keep Arizona communities safe, and ensure migrants are treated fairly and humanely.”
Sinema joined a group of bipartisan lawmakers to introduce the Public Health and Border Security Act of 2022, which seeks extends the measure for at least 60 days, noting that the surgeon general must provide “written notification to the appropriate authorizing and appropriating committees of Congress” two months before lifting the measure.

https://t.co/t81y2GfWgU
— Kyrsten Sinema (@SenatorSinema) April 14, 2022
Sen. Kyrsten Sinema on Thursday said if President Biden can extend the federal mask mandate on transportation, he also can delay his decision to lift a pandemic order at the border.https://t.co/zCqnPq95Yh
— The Washington Times (@WashTimes) April 14, 2022
NEW: Arizona Democrats @SenMarkKelly and @SenatorSinema release statements criticizing the Biden administration’s move to end Title 42.

“Arizona communities bear the brunt of the federal government’s failure at our border, so we’re stepping in and protecting border communities by ensuring the Administration works hand-in-hand with local leaders, law enforcement, and non-profits to put a comprehensive, workable plan in place before lifting Title 42,” Sinema said last week.

As the most reliable and balanced news aggregation service on the internet, DML News App offers the following information published by WASHINGTONTIMES.COM:
Sen. Kyrsten Sinema on Thursday said if President Biden can extend the federal mask mandate on transportation, he also can delay his decision to lift a pandemic order at the border.

The Arizona Democrat pointed squarely at the decision to continue COVID-19 emergency orders and compel face coverings on travelers through at least May 3 in reviving her concerns about a migrant surge once Title 42, which allowed the U.S. turn away many migrants, is lifted in late May.

Democratic Sen. Mark Kelly [AZ] echoed Sinema’s concerns, slamming the Biden administration as “wrong to set an end date for Title 42 without a comprehensive plan in place.”
Kelly and Sinema also sent a letter to Biden urging him not to allow the end of this policy.

The article goes on to state the following:
“The administration’s extension of public health emergency authorities proves the need to delay lifting Title 42 to protect the health and safety of Arizona communities and migrants,” Ms. Sinema said.
“We have not yet seen evidence that DHS has developed and implemented a sufficient plan to maintain a humane and orderly process in the event of an end to Title 42,” they wrote.
We’re pushing for transparency and accountability to secure the border and ensure the health and safety of AZ communities and migrants.
And if you have the DML NEWS APP, please tell people to download it today and help conservatives have a real voice.
The Administration’s extension of public health emergency authorities proves the need to delay lifting Title 42.
To get more information about this article, please visit WASHINGTONTIMES.COM.
She said towns at the border need time to prepare for the change.
